conbody.p: The native client can be installed on Windows by using the Windows installer GUI interface or the command-line.

section.title: Installing on Windows Using the Installer
section.p: The native client can be installed on Windows by using the NativeClient_xxxx.msi Windows installer, where xxxx represents the four-digit version of the product. The installer requires msiexec version 3.0 or higher. Version 3.0 is standard on Windows XP SP2.

Double-click the MSI file to start the installation. You can accept the default installation path, or install to a different location. The product is installed in NativeClient_xxxx, where xxxx represents the four-digit product version.
section.note: You must be logged in with administrative privileges or the MSI installation will fail.
section.p: To complete the installation, the MSI installer automatically configures these native client system environment settings:

ul.li: Sets the GFCPP environment variable to productDir, where productDir represents the NativeClient_xxxx directory (xxxx is the four-digit product version).

section.title: Repairing a Windows Installation
section.p: If problems occur with your Windows native client installation you can initiate a repair operation to restore any missing elements or registry settings. Follow these steps:

ol.li: Double-click the MSI file, then click Next in the Setup Wizard screen.
In the following screen, click the Repair button.
